section.title: Installing a License Server to Manage Licenses
section.p: If you are using floating licenses or a large number of user-based licenses (20 or more) for Oxygen XML Editor/Author/Developer, you must set up an Oxygen License Server.

section.title: Installing a License Server to Manage Licenses
section.p: To manage an floating or named-user license key, you need to install an license server.

section.title: Registering License Keys
section.p: To help you comply with the Oxygen EULA (terms of licensing), all floating or named-user licenses must be registered. This means that the license key will be locked to a particular license server deployment and no multiple uses of the same license key are possible.
During the activation process, a code that uniquely identifies your deployment of the license server is sent to the Oxygen servers. The servers will then sign the license key.

You can obtain a license key for in one of the following ways:
You can purchase one or more licenses from the website at or through one of the authorized resellers. A license key will be sent to you by email.
If your company or organization has already purchased licenses, contact your license administrator to obtain a license key or configuration details to connect to a license server.
If you purchased a subscription and you received a registration code, you can use it to obtain a license key from . A license key will be sent to you by email.
If you want to evaluate the product, you can obtain a trial license key for 30 days from the website at .
